thread.title: Samsung Galaxy Xcover 4 now appears on Geekbench with Android 7.0 and Exynos 7570 SoC
thread.title_full: Samsung Galaxy Xcover 4 now appears on Geekbench with Android 7.0 and Exynos 7570 SoC

author: Asif S.
title: Samsung Galaxy Xcover 4 now appears on Geekbench with Android 7.0 and Exynos 7570 SoC
text:
Asif S. / 5 hours ago 
The Galaxy Xcover 4 ( SM-G390F ), which received the Wi-Fi certification three weeks ago , has now appeared on Geekbench. As per the Geekbench listing, the SM-G390F seems to be running Android 7.0 Nougat using the 14nm Exynos 7570 processor and 2GB of RAM. It has been close to two years since the Galaxy Xcover 3 was unveiled, and its successor has long been due. 
The Galaxy Xcover 4 would be the first smartphone to use the Exynos 7570 processor. The chipset, which was announced back in August 2016, features a quad-core Cortex-A53 CPU, Mali-T720 GPU, and a fully integrated Cat. 4 LTE 2CA modem. Since Samsung claims that the chipset supports up to 720p displays, thereâ€™s a high chance of the Galaxy Xcover 4 featuring a 720p or an even lower resolution screen.
